questions.question: He is rich ………………….. he is not happy.
questions.description: We use but to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He sells oranges …………………… mangoes.
questions.description: We use as well as to add.

questions.question: I honor him ………………… he is an honest man.
questions.description: We use because to give the reason.

questions.question: We decided to go out ……………….. it was very late.
questions.description: We use although to connect two contrasting ideas.

questions.question: He sat down ………………… he was tired.
questions.description: We use because to give the reason for something.

questions.question: You must be quiet …………………. you must leave the room.
questions.description: We use or to present an alternative.

questions.question: He is neither a knave ……………….. a fool.
questions.description: We can combine two negative ideas with neither…nor.

questions.question: I will come …………………. I have time.
questions.description: We use if to express a condition.

questions.question: I went to the shop ……………….. bought some pens.
questions.description: We use and to merely add one statement to another.

questions.question: I waited for him ………………… he arrived.
questions.description: We use until to show time.

questions.question: He bled so profusely ……………… he died.
questions.description: The conjunction so that can express cause and effect.

questions.question: You will not get the prize ……………….. you deserve it.
questions.description: We use unless to express a condition. It is similar to if not.
